item.title: Linda add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Linda add a quote by H. L. Mencken
item.description: "If, after I depart this vale, you ever remember me and have thought to please my ghost, forgive some sinner and wink your eye at some homely girl." -- H. L. Mencken

item.title: Linda add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Linda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Linda add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "When you get a thing the way you want it, leave it alone." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "I love cats because I enjoy my home; and little by little, they become its visible soul." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Linda add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Linda add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "A bookstore is one of the only pieces of evidence we have that people are still thinking." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jonathan Winters
item.description: "I couldn't wait for success, so I went ahead without it." -- Jonathan Winters

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Fame means millions of people have the wrong idea of who you are." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Linda add a quote by Edmund Wilson
item.description: "No two persons ever read the same book." -- Edmund Wilson

item.title: Linda add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When he shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night And pay no worship to the garish sun." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Linda add a quote by Sam Wineburg
item.description: "The problem is not the content of textbooks, but the very idea of them." -- Sam Wineburg
